verses.verse: And Jacob<WH3290> went<WH1980> on his way,<WH1870> and the angels<WH4397> of God<WH430> met<WH6293> him.
And when<WH834> Jacob<WH3290> saw<WH7200> them, he said,<WH559> This<WH2088> is God's<WH430> host:<WH4264> and he called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of that<WH1931> place<WH4725> Mahanaim.<WH4266>
And Jacob<WH3290> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> before<WH6440> him to<WH413> Esau<WH6215> his brother<WH251> unto the land<WH776> of Seir,<WH8165> the country<WH7704> of Edom.<WH123>

And he commanded<WH6680> them, saying,<WH559> Thus<WH3541> shall ye speak<WH559> unto my lord<WH113> Esau;<WH6215> Thy servant<WH5650> Jacob<WH3290> saith<WH559> thus,<WH3541> I have sojourned<WH1481> with<WH5973> Laban,<WH3837> and stayed there<WH309> until<WH5704> now: <WH6258>

And I have<WH1961> oxen,<WH7794> and asses,<WH2543> flocks,<WH6629> and menservants,<WH5650> and womenservants:<WH8198> and I have sent<WH7971> to tell<WH5046> my lord,<WH113> that I may find<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in thy sight.<WH5869>

And the messengers<WH4397> returned<WH7725> to<WH413> Jacob,<WH3290> saying,<WH559> We came<WH935> to<WH413> thy brother<WH251> Esau,<WH6215> and also<WH1571> he cometh<WH1980> to meet<WH7125> thee, and four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> with<WH5973> him.

Then Jacob<WH3290> was greatly afraid<WH3372> <WH3966> and distressed:<WH3334> and he divided<WH2673> <WH853> the people<WH5971> that<WH834> was with<WH854> him, and the flocks,<WH6629> and herds,<WH1241> and the camels,<WH1581> into two<WH8147> bands;<WH4264>
And said,<WH559> If<WH518> Esau<WH6215> come<WH935> to<WH413> the one<WH259> company,<WH4264> and smite<WH5221> it, then the other company<WH4264> which is left<WH7604> shall escape.<WH6413>

And Jacob<WH3290> said,<WH559> O God<WH430> of my father<WH1> Abraham,<WH85> and God<WH430> of my father<WH1> Isaac,<WH3327> the LORD<WH3068> which saidst<WH559> unto<WH413> me, Return<WH7725> unto thy country,<WH776> and to thy kindred,<WH4138> and I will deal well<WH3190> with<WH5973> thee:

I am not worthy<WH6994> of the least of all<WH4480> <WH3605> the mercies,<WH2617> and of all<WH4480> <WH3605> the truth,<WH571> which<WH834> thou hast showed<WH6213> unto<WH853> thy servant;<WH5650> for<WH3588> with my staff<WH4731> I passed over<WH5674> <WH853> this<WH2088> Jordan;<WH3383> and now<WH6258> I am become<WH1961> two<WH8147> bands.<WH4264>

Deliver <WH5337> me, I pray thee,<WH4994> from the hand<WH4480> <WH3027> of my brother,<WH251> from the hand<WH4480> <WH3027> of Esau:<WH6215> for<WH3588> I<WH595> fear<WH3372> him, lest<WH6435> he will come<WH935> and smite<WH5221> me, and the mother<WH517> with<WH5921> the children.<WH1121>

And thou<WH859> saidst,<WH559> I will surely do thee good,<WH3190> <WH3190> <WH5973> and make<WH7760> <WH853> thy seed<WH2233> as the sand<WH2344> of the sea,<WH3220> which<WH834> cannot<WH3808> be numbered<WH5608> for multitude.<WH4480> <WH7230>
And he lodged<WH3885> there<WH8033> that same<WH1931> night;<WH3915> and took<WH3947> of<WH4480> that which came<WH935> to his hand<WH3027> a present<WH4503> for Esau<WH6215> his brother;<WH251>
Two hundred<WH3967> she goats,<WH5795> and twenty<WH6242> he goats,<WH8495> two hundred<WH3967> ewes,<WH7353> and twenty<WH6242> rams,<WH352>
Thirty <WH7970> milch<WH3243> camels<WH1581> with their colts,<WH1121> forty<WH705> kine,<WH6510> and ten<WH6235> bulls,<WH6499> twenty<WH6242> she asses,<WH860> and ten<WH6235> foals.<WH5895>

And he delivered<WH5414> them into the hand<WH3027> of his servants,<WH5650> every drove<WH5739> <WH5739> by themselves;<WH905> and said<WH559> unto<WH413> his servants,<WH5650> Pass over<WH5674> before<WH6440> me, and put<WH7760> a space<WH7305> between<WH996> drove<WH5739> and drove.<WH5739>

And he commanded<WH6680> <WH853> the foremost,<WH7223> saying,<WH559> When<WH3588> Esau<WH6215> my brother<WH251> meeteth<WH6298> thee, and asketh<WH7592> thee, saying,<WH559> Whose<WH4310> art thou?<WH859> and whither<WH575> goest<WH1980> thou? and whose<WH4310> are these<WH428> before<WH6440> thee?

Then thou shalt say,<WH559> They be thy servant<WH5650> Jacob's;<WH3290> it<WH1931> is a present<WH4503> sent<WH7971> unto my lord<WH113> Esau:<WH6215> and, behold,<WH2009> also<WH1571> he<WH1931> is behind<WH310> us.

And so<WH1571> commanded<WH6680> he<WH853> the second,<WH8145> and<WH1571> <WH853> the third,<WH7992> and<WH1571> <WH853> all<WH3605> that followed<WH1980> <WH310> the droves,<WH5739> saying,<WH559> On this<WH2088> manner<WH1697> shall ye speak<WH1696> unto<WH413> Esau,<WH6215> when ye find<WH4672> him.

And say<WH559> ye moreover,<WH1571> Behold,<WH2009> thy servant<WH5650> Jacob<WH3290> is behind<WH310> us. For<WH3588> he said,<WH559> I will appease<WH3722> <WH6440> him with the present<WH4503> that goeth<WH1980> before<WH6440> me, and afterward<WH310> <WH3651> I will see<WH7200> his face;<WH6440> peradventure<WH194> he will accept<WH5375> <WH6440> of me.
So went<WH5674> the present<WH4503> over before<WH5921> <WH6440> him: and himself<WH1931> lodged<WH3885> that<WH1931> night<WH3915> in the company.<WH4264>

And he rose up<WH6965> that<WH1931> night,<WH3915> and took<WH3947> <WH853> his two<WH8147> wives,<WH802> and his two<WH8147> womenservants,<WH8198> and his eleven<WH259> <WH6240> sons,<WH3206> and passed over<WH5674> <WH853> the ford<WH4569> Jabbok.<WH2999>
And he took<WH3947> them, and sent them over<WH5674> <WH853> the brook,<WH5158> and sent over<WH5674> <WH853> that<WH834> he had.
And Jacob<WH3290> was left<WH3498> alone;<WH905> and there wrestled<WH79> a man<WH376> with<WH5973> him until<WH5704> the breaking<WH5927> of the day.<WH7837>

And when he saw<WH7200> that<WH3588> he prevailed<WH3201> not<WH3808> against him, he touched<WH5060> the hollow<WH3709> of his thigh;<WH3409> and the hollow<WH3709> of Jacob's<WH3290> thigh<WH3409> was out of joint,<WH3363> as he wrestled<WH79> with<WH5973> him.
And he said,<WH559> Let me go,<WH7971> for<WH3588> the day<WH7837> breaketh.<WH5927> And he said,<WH559> I will not<WH3808> let thee go,<WH7971> except<WH3588> <WH518> thou bless<WH1288> me.
And he said<WH559> unto<WH413> him, What<WH4100> is thy name?<WH8034> And he said,<WH559> Jacob.<WH3290>

And he said,<WH559> Thy name<WH8034> shall be called<WH559> no<WH3808> more<WH5750> Jacob,<WH3290> but<WH3588> <WH518> Israel:<WH3478> for<WH3588> as a prince hast thou power<WH8280> with<WH5973> God<WH430> and with<WH5973> men,<WH376> and hast prevailed.<WH3201>

And Jacob<WH3290> asked<WH7592> him, and said,<WH559> Tell<WH5046> me, I pray thee,<WH4994> thy name.<WH8034> And he said,<WH559> Wherefore<WH4100> is it<WH2088> that thou dost ask<WH7592> after my name?<WH8034> And he blessed<WH1288> him there.<WH8033>

And Jacob<WH3290> called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of the place<WH4725> Peniel:<WH6439> for<WH3588> I have seen<WH7200> God<WH430> face<WH6440> to<WH413> face,<WH6440> and my life<WH5315> is preserved.<WH5337>
And as<WH834> he passed over<WH5674> <WH853> Penuel<WH6439> the sun<WH8121> rose<WH2224> upon him, and he<WH1931> halted<WH6760> upon<WH5921> his thigh.<WH3409>

Therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> eat<WH398> not<WH3808> of<WH853> the sinew<WH1517> which shrank,<WH5384> which<WH834> is upon<WH5921> the hollow<WH3709> of the thigh,<WH3409> unto<WH5704> this<WH2088> day:<WH3117> because<WH3588> he touched<WH5060> the hollow<WH3709> of Jacob's<WH3290> thigh<WH3409> in the sinew<WH1517> that shrank.<WH5384>
